body:
<!--To help us understand and resolve your issue, please fill out the form to the best of your ability. Feel free to delete the sections that do not apply.-->

**Description of the problem**

When using the one-liner syntax and one misses to properly specify `-format prefix`, and just uses `-format` the behavior of GMT depends on the module. If full new syntax with `gmt begin ... gmt end` is used this case is covered.

**Full script that generated the error**


**1. Proper usage:**
```
gmt coast -R4/8/-2/2 -JM6i -Bafg1 -Wthinnest,black -pdf example_filename
```
Works as expected. 

**2. Incorrect usage, note the missing `example_filename`:**
```
gmt coast -R4/-2/8/2r -JM6i -Bafg1 -Wthinnest,black -pdf
```
Runs through but nothing is generated. Neither a file nor an error message

**3. Incorrect usage, same module, different error:**
```
gmt coast -JL-24.9/16.55/16.3/16.7/20c -R-25.14/16.75/-24.8/16.95r \
  -Wthinnest,black -pdf
```
Fails with error message:
```
coast [ERROR]: Error in -p (df): Syntax is -p[x|y|z]<azim>[/<elev>[/<zlevel>]][+w<lon0>/<lat0>[/<z0>][+v<x0>/<y0>]
coast [ERROR]: Syntax error -p option. Correct syntax:
	-p[x|y|z]<azim>[/<elev>[/<zlevel>]][+w<lon0>/<lat0>[/<z0>][+v<x0>/<y0>]
	   Azimuth and elevation (and zlevel) of the viewpoint [180/90/bottom z-axis].
	   Append +w and +v to set coordinates to a fixed viewpoint
coast [ERROR]: Offending option -pdf
```

**4. Incorrect usage, full modern syntax:**
```
gmt begin
  gmt coast -JL-24.9/16.55/16.3/16.7/20c -R-25.14/16.75/-24.8/16.95r \
    -Wthinnest,black  -Bafg1 -Wthinnest,black
gmt end show
```
Same command but full syntax runs and uses `gmtsession` as file name prefix.

**Expected outcome**

I expected a nice error message along the lines "missing file name prefix" or something or even better just a notice and a behavior like the full modern syntax.

**System information**

* Operating system: macOS 10.15.4
* GMT version (`gmt --version`): 6.0.0
title: End nicely if one-liner has to deal with incomplete -format prefix declaration
